subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “to bind; rope”
: From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*rej ~ s-rwi(j)||obscure internal channel; cord; string; creeper; cane; rattan}}; cognate with {{cog|lus|hrui||creeper; cane; rope}}, {{cog|my|ရိုး||kind of creeper; tree (''in compounds'')}}.
: Related to {{och-l|虆|creeper; rambler}}, {{och-l|藟|to wind; creeper}} ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1982}}).
: {{cog|tai-pro|*roːjᶜ||to string together}} (whence {{cog|th|ร้อย}}) may be a loan from Chinese ({{zh-ref|Manomaivibool, 1975}}).

Also see {{och-l|累}}.
